t models. In NEAT there is a bias input which has a constant value 
of 1.0.=
 There is clear advantage for using it, otherwise the 
hyperplanes that the=
 nodes represent would all cross the origin of the 
hyperspace, which is li=
miting the possible behaviors the NN can have. 
But not all nodes in NEAT h=
ave a connection to the bias node. Evolution 
connects nodes to it when onl=
y when it is useful. In this way the 
search space is further minimized, NE=
AT does not have to search for a 
proper bias on every node. 
However, in H=
yperNEAT substrates, it is better to have a bias in every 
neuron anyway, t=
hen the biases will be "drawn" by the CPPN.
